identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study of TAS0612 in Participants With Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumor Cancer
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase 1 Study of TAS0612 in Patients With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to see if TAS0612 is safe in participants with advanced or metastatic solid tumor cancer.

primaryOutcomes.description: Number of participants with DLTs during cycle 1

Percentage of participants with partial response (PR) or complete response (CR) at 6 months Prostate Cancer Working Group 3 (PCWG3)/ modified defined by the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (mRECIST) v1.1.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline through measured progressive disease (estimated up to 12 months)

secondaryOutcomes.description: DCR: Percentage of participants who exhibit stable disease (SD), PR or CR.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline through progressive disease or date of death for any causes, whichever comes first, assessed up to 12 months.

secondaryOutcomes.description: DOR: Date of PR or CR to date of objective progression or death due to any cause.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline through progressive disease or date of death for any causes, whichever comes first, assessed up to 12 months.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Radiographic Progression Free Survival (rPFS) per PCWG3/mRECIST1.1
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of patients experiencing a radiographic progression by PCWG3/mRECIST1.1 criteria
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline through progressive disease or date of death for any causes, whichever comes first, assessed up to 6 months.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of patients experiencing a best overall response of Complete Response (CR) or Partial response (PR)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline through progressive disease or date of death for any causes, whichever comes first, assessed up to 12 months.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of patients with ≥50% reduction in PSA from baseline to lowest post-baseline result.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline to PSA progression, up to 12 months

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK) parameters including but not limited to: Cmax
secondaryOutcomes.description: time of TAS0612 it takes to reach Cmax.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Cycle 1 Day 1 through Cycle 1 Day 15 (28-day cycle) Cycle 2 Day 1 and Cycle 3 Day 1

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK) parameters including but not limited to: Tmax
secondaryOutcomes.description: time of TAS0612 it takes to reach Cmax,
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Cycle 1 Day 1 through Cycle 1 Day 15 (28-day cycle) Cycle 2 Day 1 and Cycle 3 Day 1

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK) parameters including but not limited to: AUC.
secondaryOutcomes.description: Area under the plasma concentration curve of TAS0612.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Cycle 1 Day 1 through Cycle 1 Day 15 (28-day cycle) Cycle 2 Day 1 and Cycle 3 Day 1

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK) parameters including but not limited to: T1/2.
secondaryOutcomes.description: time it takes for plasma concentration to fall by half its original value (t1/2) of TAS0612
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Cycle 1 Day 1 through Cycle 1 Day 15 (28-day cycle) Cycle 2 Day 1 and Cycle 3 Day 1

secondaryOutcomes.description: All adverse events (AEs) per CTCAE v5.0.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From screening to 30 days after last dose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pharmacodynamic: biochemical effects of TAS0612: Total proteins
secondaryOutcomes.description: Total proteins will be measured in blood samples collected at different time points.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Cycle 1 Day 1 through Cycle 1 Day 15 (28-day cycle)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pharmacodynamic: biochemical effects of TAS0612: phospho-proteins
secondaryOutcomes.description: Phospho-proteins will be measured in blood samples collected at different time points. The levels/changes (dose- and concentration-dependent) of phospho-proteins will be assessed and reported for biochemical effects of TAS0612.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Cycle 1 Day 1 through Cycle 1 Day 15 (28-day cycle)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pharmacodynamic: molecular effects in tumor tissue of TAS0612
secondaryOutcomes.description: Selected phospho-proteins will be analyzed in tumor tissue at baseline and on-treatment in dose escalation. The levels/changes of the phospho-proteins will be assessed and reported for target modulation.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline through Day 1 Cycle 2 (28-day cycle) through study completion, an average of 1 year

otherOutcomes.description: Structure elucidation of TAS0612 metabolites in human plasma.

otherOutcomes.measure: Time-matched plasma exposures of TAS0612 and changes from baseline in QTcF using central ECG measurements
otherOutcomes.description: To explore the correlation between the incidence of exposures of TAS0612 in plasma and QT prolongation
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline through progressive disease or date of death for any causes, whichever comes first, assessed up to 12 months

otherOutcomes.measure: Exploratory correlation of tissue and/or blood markers with tumor efficacy endpoints and/or tumor resistance to TAS0612
otherOutcomes.description: To investigate potential predictive biomarkers for TAS0612.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline through progressive disease or date of death for any causes, whichever comes first, assessed up to 12 months.

otherOutcomes.measure: Exposure of TAS0612 and selected efficacy and safety measures.
otherOutcomes.description: To explore the correlation between PK and antitumor activity or toxicity
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline through progressive disease or date of death for any causes, whichever comes first, assessed up to 12 months.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Dose Escalation:

Have histologically confirmed, locally advanced, and unresectable cancer, or metastatic cancer and have progressed on or were intolerant to standard treatments or refused standard of care (SOC).

Dose Expansion:

Have documented histologically or cytologically confirmed adenocarcinoma of the prostate with documented PTEN loss or loss of function mutation, who have metastatic castration-resistant disease and have:

* Disease progression per the Prostate Cancer Clinical Trials Working Group 3 (PCWG3)/modified RECIST 1.1 after the most recent regimen.
* Received androgen receptor directed therapy previously with or without chemotherapy consisting of no more than 2 prior taxane-based regimens.
* Been receiving androgen deprivation therapy with serum testosterone \<50 ng/dL (\<2.0 nM). Note: previously documented PTEN loss or loss of function mutation from archived tissue sample testing or cfDNA sample testing is acceptable if done in a CLIA certified lab or a locally certified lab.

Have an ECOG score of 0 or 1 Dose Escalation (Part 1): Have no measurable or measurable disease per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) 1.1.

Dose Expansion (Part 2): Have measurable or no measurable disease per PCWG3/modified RECIST 1.1

• No more than 30 patients with no measurable disease will be enrolled in Dose Expansion (Part 2).

Exclusion Criteria:

* Participating in medical research not compatible with this study
* Have not discontinued or recovered from previous treatments for cancer
* Have a significant cardiac condition
* Have untreated brain metastases
* Have a primary brain tumor
* Have a serious concomitant disorder
* Unable to swallow or digest pills
* Poorly controlled diabetes
* Concomitant medications or substances that are strong inhibitors/inducers of CYP3A.Study

locations.facility: University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center
Centre de Lutte Contre le Cancer Gustave Roussy

browseBranches.name: Urinary Tract, Sexual Organs, and Pregnancy Conditions
